thread.title: Culinary carpet ride across MacarthurTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Culinary carpet ride across MacarthurTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Culinary carpet ride across Macarthur Published on : Thursday, October 8, 2015
The produce, wine and craft beer of the historic Macarthur region – the birthplace of Australia’s agriculture and wine industries – will be showcased at a special, fine dining food event on Saturday, October 24, when the Campbelltown Catholic Club hosts ‘The 15 Mile Dinner’.
The culinary carpet ride across the rolling hills, green pastures and wide rivers of the Macarthur region on the south-western fringes of Sydney will tap the region’s growing village approach to locally-sourced food, with visitors to Macarthur invited to share in the bounty.
Colonial entrepreneurs, John and Elizabeth Macarthur, pioneered Australia’s agricultural and wine industries on a farm near what is now Camden and Campbelltown in the early 19th Century, with the region’s premium meats, poultry, vegetables, dairy products, wine and beer now enjoying a renaissance in popularity.
On Saturday, October 24, 2015, the executive chef of the Campbelltown Catholic Club, Paul Rifkin, and his team will indulge appreciative foodies with a unique degustation experience using the finest ingredients and products sourced throughout and within 15 miles (24km) of the Macarthur region. Each course will be matched with local wines and craft beer.
Profiling the finest flavours of Macarthur, the 15 Mile Dinner begins at 7pm at the Campbelltown Catholic Club on Saturday, October 24, 2015, and costs $125 per person (18+ event , including matched wine and beer.
Source:- Visit Macarthur
